posts.post_content:
Honestly, while not a *better* card than [Thoughtseize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thoughtseize), I would sooner spend money on a playset of these than of those. Honestly what are you going to go after with a 1CMC discarder? You're going to try to get the base of your opponent's game, the combo enablers, the early game creatures, the accelerators, not the top of their mana curve.   
  
This is functionally a Thoughtsieze for a fraction of the price and very little loss in utility. Great card.
posts.html:
Honestly, while not a better card than Thoughtseize, I would sooner spend money on a playset of these than of those. Honestly what are you going to go after with a 1CMC discarder? You're going to try to get the base of your opponent's game, the combo enablers, the early game creatures, the accelerators, not the top of their mana curve.

This is functionally a Thoughtsieze for a fraction of the price and very little loss in utility. Great card.

Posted By: True_Smog (4/27/2010 1:33:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: You don't need to discard [Force Of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force Of Will) if you wreck their hand discarding all their [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm) or whatever else. You could just as easily make Force Of Will become a dead card in decks running 3 colors. They need a card to pitch to FOW and sometimes they won't have many. Also, if someone pitches a card to counter you, they knock out two cards from their hand, then when you [Hymn To Tourach](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hymn To Tourach) them you will feel better. FOW is one of the last cards I reach for. It is the opposite of card advantage. Why would you choose it as a target?
posts.html:
You don't need to discard Force Of Will if you wreck their hand discarding all their Brainstorm or whatever else. You could just as easily make Force Of Will become a dead card in decks running 3 colors. They need a card to pitch to FOW and sometimes they won't have many. posts.post_content: I see this card much more in legacy than anyone seems to give it credit for. Most every major threat is gonna come early so it hits all of them and considering most of the strongest decks out there range from aggro loam, maverik, elves, delver, rug, countertop this card tends to be a take all of importance. Jace, the mind sculptor is a pain in every black decks back side but that's why you play therapy, hymn, duress or thoughtseize along side this. this card deserves at least 4.5/5 stars.
